note: Environmentalist who believes in the power of good, or, to borrow from Spinoza "adequate", information. Concerned with how a rapidly changing and increasingly uncertain world will re-shape society, and in particular the way this intersects with national security and international stability.

100% reader-funded writer. All works co-authored with my American husband Tim Foley.

Writer and lecturer teaching #sustainability, #SocialInnovation & #SystemicDesign (#SystemsThinking & #design). Launching an upcycling social enterprise (morphbags.com) and publisher of a small press (wickedproblemscollaborative.com). Co-founder of the Circular Design Lab (circulardesignlab.org). Bureacracy is my kryptonite.

Editor: What do we do about inequality? & What do we do after the pandemic?

Life is a preposterous horror.

Money speaks for money, the devil for his own
Who comes to speak for the skin and the bone?

The law locks up the man or woman
Who steals the goose off the common
But leaves the greater villain loose
Who steals the common from the goose.

Long time activist/researcher. Was an editor in days gone by. Focussed now on #environment, #climate, and #pandemic issues along with human rights, animal rights, and immigrant rights.  https://nedhamsonsecondlineviewofthenews.com  Authored/co-authored three books on quality management, #innovation and organizational change. note:
California, Ireland, Colorado.
MS Math/CompSci UCLA.
Locus, Sun Microsystems; PDP-11, x86, C, Go.
Programming since 1973.
I wrote the program that calculated the GPA that appears on my high-school transcript.

Starting in 1984 I led the project at Locus to create the first x86 virtual machine, to run MS-DOS under Unix, on the AT&T 6300 Plus (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/6300_Plus).

The lines in the avatar are horizontal.
née Twitter @weaselx86
There should be no profit in human misery.
